TSM121.name: Fundamentals of Electricity
TSM121.description: Application of Ohm's law. Kirchoff's laws. Series and parallel circuits. Inductive and capacitive reactance. Power factor. Practical single and three-phase electrical systems. Electromagnetic induction. Transformers. Environmental constraints in power use and production.
TSM121.restrictions: Open to students in the Electrical Technology Major.

TSM130.name: Energy Efficiency and Conservation in Agricultural Systems
TSM130.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
TSM130.description: Introduction and basic concepts of energy efficiency and conservation in agricultural and food production systems.

TSM222.name: Fundamentals of Automation and Controls
TSM222.description: On-off controllers for electric actuators. Installation according to code. Ladder-logic. Programmable logic controllers. Installation and programming. Interfacing to a computer.
TSM222.prerequisite: (TSM 121 or concurrently) or MTH 103 or approval of department

TSM251.name: Information Technology in Agricultural Systems
TSM251.description: Applications and trends in information systems. Evaluation and use of computer systems, peripherals, networks, management decision support software, presentation systems, and communication systems.

TSM331.name: Water Management in Agriculture and Food Systems
TSM331.description: Principles of water management, use efficiency and conservation in agricultural production, natural resources and food processing facilities. Best agricultural water management practices, water rights, irrigation scheduling, irrigation systems selection, evaluation and management and drainage principles. Large scale water use, management and conservation in food processing.
TSM331.prerequisite: MTH 103 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or LB 118

TSM343.name: Principles of Precision Agriculture
TSM343.description: Global positioning systems (GPS), yield monitors, and computer software. Analysis and interpretation of field maps. Variable-rate application. Economics of precision agriculture.
TSM343.prerequisite: MTH 103 or MTH 114 or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132

TSM490.name: Independent Study
TSM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
TSM490.description: Supervised individual student research and study in technology systems management.

TSM491.name: Special Topics
TSM491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
TSM491.description: Special topics in technology systems management.

TSM493.name: Professional Internship in Technology Systems Management
TSM493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
TSM493.description: Supervised professional experiences in agencies and businesses related to a student's major field of study.
TSM493.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources. Approval of department; application required. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in any or all of these courses
